definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: The enemy attacked our foremost positions all night.
sentences.chinese: 整整一夜敵人攻打了我們的前沿陣地。

sentences.english: Then came Amalek, and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
sentences.chinese: 後來，亞瑪力人來到利非訂攻打以色列人。

sentences.english: I will join in the assault upon Icecrown Citadel when the time to strike upon us.
sentences.chinese: 我將會在時機降臨時加入攻打冰冠城塞的最後一戰。

sentences.english: They were the reports of the cannon battering the barricade.
sentences.chinese: 事實上那是攻打街壘的炮聲。

sentences.english: And he smote Moab; and the Moabites became David's servants, and brought gifts.
sentences.chinese: 又攻打摩押，摩押人就歸服大衛，給他進貢。

sentences.english: So the Jin troops used the path that they borrowed to attack Guo and they scored a decisive victory.
sentences.chinese: 晉大軍通過虞國道路，攻打虢國，很快就取得了勝利。

sentences.english: David also defeated the Moabites, and they became subject to him and brought tribute.
sentences.chinese: 又攻打摩押，摩押人就歸服大衛，給他進貢。

sentences.english: Then Joshua and all Israel with him turned around and attacked Debir.
sentences.chinese: 約書亞和以色列衆人回到底璧，攻打這城。

sentences.english: And the Chaldeans shall come again, and fight against this city, and take it, and burn it with fire.
sentences.chinese: 迦勒底人必再來攻打這城，並要攻取，用火焚燒。

sentences.english: And David enquired of God, saying, Shall I go up against the Philistines?
sentences.chinese: 大衛求問神，說，我可以上去攻打非利士人嗎。

sentences.english: Mr. Lincoln, the colonel elected by the people, commanded the soldiers to attack the capital.
sentences.chinese: 林肯先生，人民選舉出來的上校，命令士兵攻打首都。

sentences.english: Guan Yu was hit by a poisonous arrow in the right arm while attacking Fancheng City.
sentences.chinese: 關羽攻打樊城時，被毒箭射中右臂。

sentences.english: "Ark Royal" was once led invasion of Iraq to participate in the British navy.
sentences.chinese: “皇家方舟”號曾經領導英國海軍參加攻打伊拉克。

sentences.english: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.
sentences.chinese: 他們圍繞我，說怨恨的話，又無故地攻打我。

sentences.english: And Joab fought against Rabbath of the children of Ammon, and laid close siege to the royal city.
sentences.chinese: 那時，約阿布正攻打阿孟子民的辣巴，佔據了水城。

sentences.english: The last time he went N. K. was threatening to nuke us within days.
sentences.chinese: 上一次他去的時候，朝鮮威脅着要用核武器攻打我們。

definition: to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to dispatch an army/to send troops
to go on a punitive expedition
to reinforce/to increase troop numbers/reinforcements/extra troops
to suppress by armed force/to send a punitive expedition against/to crusade against
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
